description.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

title.narrative: Costa Rica United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Costa Rica Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Inclusion)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Costa Rica 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/003 SOCIAL INCLUSION, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened advocacy, dialogue, knowledge and capacities and mobilized key audiences, enhancing and expanding its presence in communication media and social networks and reaching more than 6 million people with messages on the situation and rights of children and adolescents. UNICEF and its partners achieved approval of an innovative 2020-2024 Policy on Youth and impacted 15,000 young persons with innovative programs and models for building life skills and employability, empowerment, violence prevention, gender equity and art for social change. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Instruments implemented for measuring the outreach, knowledge an d commitment of the population towards the fulfillment of children and adolescent rights and the UNICEF brand.

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed on the basis of the Global Strategy for Communication and Advocacy

target.value: 2022:By 2022, there is one or more measurement instruments implemented for each of the programme´s component.

title.narrative: Developed and supported social agreements on children and adolescents rights supported by political and social leaders, based on an action platform for the eradication of the main manifestations of exclusion and vulnerabilities that children and adolescents face.

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed within the framework of the agreements promoted in the UNDAF.

target.value: 2022:At least three social agreements on children and adolescent´s issues signed by political leaders and society.

title.narrative: A Civil Societys advocacy plan elaborated.

baseline.value: Civil society advocacy mechanisms at the CNNA, ANNA, etc.

target.value: 2022:The Civil Society has been able to successfully participate and advocate its positions at the CNNA, ANNA, SDG working groups, among others.

title.narrative: Developed and implemented the "Comptroller of Childhood and Adolescence Services".

baseline.value: Costa Rica doesnt has child services comptroller system

target.value: 2022:The country will have in operation a "Comptroller for Child and Adolescent Services" that improves the quality and outreach of public services for children and adolescents.

actual.value: 2019:In 2018, the focus was on the preparation of a series of strategic studies that will inform UNICEF´s work in Generation Unlimited during the forthcoming years: a participatory analysis on needed capacities, life skills and employability for young people; a proposal of innovative models to promote th

title.narrative: UNICEF-supported Government-led coordination mechanism/s for C4D meet/s quality standards

baseline.value: The UNICEF Costa Rica Office has initiated a process of support to the Government, for the implementation of C4D models.

target.value: 2022:By 2022, it is expected to have contributed to the development of a model (design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation) of C4D in the country.
